website_summaries.verdict: Mainstays of the trail had better prepare to have their expectations exceeded by the Merrell Moab FST 2. From its sizing-consistent fit to its immense lightness, the footwear has excellence written all over it. And this is with no mention of the gear’s exceptional level of comfort and fantastically supportive arch zone yet. Having said all that, outdoorsy folks quite particular with flexibility might be slightly disappointed with this shoe. Nonetheless, the Moab FST 2 is an amazing Merrell product, one that is vastly capable of emboldening day hikers out in the great outdoors.
pros: According to a number of consumers, the Merrell Moab FST 2 runs true to size
Numerous reviewers rated this hiker quite highly in the comfort category
Several wearers found their Merrell Moab FST 2 hiking shoes surprisingly lightweight
Its outstanding arch support delighted many owners
This footgear impressed a couple of users with its almost non-existent break-in period
An expert was greatly stoked by the shoe’s attractive design
The Moab FST 2 earned the respect of a customer for having a well-constructed default footbed
The Moab FST 2 (men’s and women’s) is available in multiple colorways
Its versatility was praised by a couple of online shoppers
They commented that this shoe could be worn to work
Most users were satisfied with its overall performance
The ratings it received were often four to five stars
cons: A tester wished that the shoe had more give around its flex points
A wearer was frustrated with the tongue of the shoe
She noted that it was not wide enough near the opening which gave her a hard time tucking it in

customer_reviews.title: They're shoes!
customer_reviews.text: They came and I was all like, damn, these things are shoes! They have laces so you can strap them to your feet and then walk around without stuff jabbing into your feet. Where have these things been all my life?!!?
customer_reviews.author: EcoPawz

customer_reviews.title: Fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: I usually have good fortune with merrell, these shoes are of good quality and support,but the fit? Nah, these are more narrow than I'm use to with merrell I have a duck foot and the laces are spread a good bit apart, and with socks on there almost bordering on tight, so that's my experience with this shoe. It's just okay, maybe I overlooked the sizing chart for this particular line.
customer_reviews.author: Tasty Cakes

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give high marks on fit probably because I should have ordered a half size larger. Hoping they will break-in and not feel too tight in the future. So far I have worn them for less than an hour. I bought them for exercise shoes, for which they should be fine. The sole seems thin for hiking shoes. Love the looks and quality of construction.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Haydn-myer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for actual use.
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof or water resistant or easy to dry...not recommended for hikes that have streems, the potential of rain, sleet, hail, and snow in the same June weekend in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: isaiah17_7

customer_reviews.title: Great walking, jogging, light hiking and trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They are light and though they’re not waterproof my feet stay dry and light rain and wet grass. Good traction and does not feel like I am walking on cleats. I had an issue with the soul peeling up a bit and contacted Merrell. Customers support was fantastic and they replaced my shoes. New shoes are great!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Jarvah

customer_reviews.title: So much want to keep these but.....
customer_reviews.text: These are really good looking and comfortable except for one issue. I need a shoe with deep insole and large volume due to arthritic big toes which require me to wear deep insert. They were close but just a little too tight. I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: T. Goben

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes everyday. Can't say enough about them. If you have an odd size or fat foot, please check before ordering them. If you want super comfortable everyday or light hiking shoe look no further. I have tried just about everything and keep coming back. Thanks for a quality product. I have no affiliation what so ever with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worried at first
customer_reviews.text: I wore them around the house before hiking in them and I thought they were going to be a little uncomfortable and "pinchy". I wore them on a 3 mile hike, including a foothill climb, and they felt great throughout the hike.
customer_reviews.author: RockinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good shoe so far
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Aggressive tread, styling, comfortable Cons: A little tight/narrow through the tongue, but some break in will probably solve that. Concern: The ankle cut is a little lower than expected and the shoe doesn't cup my heel very much. I've only worn them to the office so far and they're fine, but the low cup might be bad for intense trail use. I'll just have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the right price
customer_reviews.text: Like that I got a good price on them these are the only shoes I can use for work
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Broke these in a bit then took them of a hike at Clifty Falls State Park. These shoes performed amazingly. I was there all day and they held up great. It was hot and muggy but my feet had the necessary ventilation. I was able to go anywhere I wanted including extremely steep descents/ascents. LOVE these shoes. A great deal. Would buy again but don’t need to as I can tell this one pair is going to last a long time. Super durable. And someone above mentioned he thought they were fake—mine did come in a Merrell box and looked identical to his.
customer_reviews.author: Melanio

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but they don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Tread separating from shoe after less than a year (mind you I rotate these shoes with several other pair). Amazon support only covers 30 days and Merrell Support was not helpful. As much as I love the shoe I cannot continue to but then at these prices. I bought the same shoe in two different colors and they are both failing in the same spot.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Harkness

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable Merrill I have bought in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrill shoes. This one is by far the most comfortable pair I have ever worn right out-of-the box. In fact, I ordered a second pair within 2 hours of receiving my first, because there was only one pair left in my size and color. If my opinion changes after a couple of days of wearing them, I will come back and say so.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Good for old injury recovery
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband. He suffers from an old injury and the base of this sneaker/ boot keeps him steady to. Do all he wants to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kitcat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with these shoes. I’ve been a Keen guy for years but Keens have been giving me fits and black toenails the last year. These Merrill’s feel great and the support is amazing. I’d give them more than 5 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great looking hiking shoes and the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas present for my son-in-law. The shoes look great and I'm anxious to give them to him.
customer_reviews.author: DebinNH

customer_reviews.title: Merrell is a Great brand
customer_reviews.text: Awesome comfortable shoe. Love the tread and overall design. I give these an "A" in quality style and pricing.
customer_reviews.author: prescottkid

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of fst Moab 2. I ordered my first pair from a different seller 3 weeks ago. I absolutely love them. I have concerns about this pair. According to the seller all fst shoes are waterproof. My issue comes down to this new pair does not have the “select dry” tag on the shoes where my other pair does. Seems a little odd is all.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Dovier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, great build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes! They look like they do in the pictures, and they fit perfectly. The build quality feels excellent, too.
customer_reviews.author: AncientAstronaut

customer_reviews.title: Tread failure.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, comfortable and great traction. Fell apart after one hiking trip of about 15-20 miles. Toe cover peeling off and tread pieces peeling off individually. Filled out form on Merrell site. Wouldn’t buy this style again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Not a bad thing to say about them!! I wear them everyday and they are extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes, somewhat of a sneaker look with the durability of a hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Flip1950

customer_reviews.title: Fit like the Moab.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight shoe. I like the Merrel Moab fit (slightly wide at the ball of foot) and these fit good. Used for walking about 2-3 miles per day, on pavement, road shoulder, and occasional off the shoulder to avoid getting hit by cars and trucks. Good grippy soles for the off-road.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F Shea

customer_reviews.title: Poor design with faulty materials
customer_reviews.text: The 2nd pair that came as a replacement for the first and they started fraying at the same spot by the inner ankle. They did the same thing as the first pair. Plus toe area is delaminating in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Devin B. Tegen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes this is his 2nd pair.... he wears them to work!
customer_reviews.author: amysworld71

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth different pair of Merrel shoes. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: The best shows brand to my opinion. Vibram sole Saved me several times and slip on water and ice. There is nothing I don't like about Merrell with Vibram sole.
customer_reviews.author: Ken 😎

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Light and comfortable with excellent sole. Suggest to buy half to one larger size.
customer_reviews.author: G.Bogues

customer_reviews.title: Love Merrell shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the ways these looked and they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Terri L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and made of very good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Ovidio H. Giron Jr

customer_reviews.title: Shoe good
customer_reviews.text: Shoe good. Fits feet’s. Good for walk and run. Yes.
customer_reviews.author: pename

customer_reviews.title: Got a damaged Item
customer_reviews.text: Just got Item but it like used already So I’m totally return it 😌.
customer_reviews.author: Siriporn Nilsawit

customer_reviews.title: Good Moab variant
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits as most Merrells do for me which is about a half size small and a little narrow. Great feel on my foot just like my last standard Moab Vents. They are lighter and definitely more breathable than those were as well which means they will only be good for relatively dry hikes and walks. I do like the sole on these more and it does feel more grippy on wet surfaces than the standard Moab sole did. Good shoe with a snug lock in fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smiles

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is a bit narrower than the Moab 2. They still fit me good.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dreamer

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab FST 2 Hiking Shoe, Black/Granite, 08.0 M US
product_meta.description: Get out there and experience nature in style and comfort with the versatile Merrell® Moab FST 2 shoe! Nubuck leather and mesh upper. Traditional lace closure. Bellows tongue keeps debris out. M Select™ FRESH antimicrobial agents reduces shoe odor. Breathable mesh lining. Kinetic Fit™ BASE insole is contoured like your foot and provides flexible, intuitive support for connected and protected movement. Molded nylon arch shank. Merrell Air Cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability. Vibram® MegaGrip® for the best combination of traction and durability on wet or dry surfaces. 5 mm lug depth. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 14 oz Product measurements were taken using size 11, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Vibram MegaGrip for the best combination of traction and durability on wet or dry surfaces
Kinetic Fit BASE insole is contoured like your foot and provides flexible, intuitive support for connected and protected movement
